channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Dollar Tree warns tariffs might force it to increase prices—and stop selling some products entirely
item.description: "We are prepared to act on multiple fronts,” said chief operating officer Mike Creedon.

item.title: ‘Targeted attack’ on UnitedHealthcare CEO ushers in a grim new era for executive safety fears
item.description: The health care business leader was gunned down yesterday in Manhattan.

item.title: Millions in Northern U.S. Under Winter Storm Warnings

item.title: Gazans With Disabilities Face ‘Impossible Times’ of Chaos and War

item.title: 1 in 5 people have this genetic risk factor for heart disease—and most have no idea because doctors rarely test for it
item.description: It's not only cholesterol that's worrisome: Elevated levels of lipoprotein(a) increase your risk of heart attack and stroke.

item.title: Shooting of Brian Thompson, UnitedHealthcare CEO, in NYC: What We Know
item.description: Mr. Thompson was on his way to an investors’ gathering when he was killed by a masked shooter who fled on an electric bike, the police said.

item.title: For Macron, Notre-Dame’s Reopening Offers Respite From Political Crisis
item.description: The 860-year-old cathedral has been repaired in a time frame many thought impossible. But rather than basking in success, President Emmanuel Macron is...

item.title: Syrian Rebels Storm Hama as Government Forces Withdraw
item.description: In another startling setback for President Bashar al-Assad, government forces retreated from the city of Hama after rebels advanced.

item.title: Rohit Bal, Exuberant Star of Indian Fashion, Dies at 63
item.description: Known as “the bad boy of fashion,” he was among a wave of designers who created modern Indian couture by updating traditional garments.

item.title: The Most Stylish People of 2024

item.title: DraftKings and FanDuel score a major win after the ballot measure to allow sportsbetting in Missouri barely scrapes by
item.description: The $43 million campaign—a record for a Missouri ballot measure—was funded almost entirely by the two companies.

item.title: Gadi Amit, famed Fitbit designer, wants his peers to challenge the ‘money and tech folks’
item.description: At Fortune's Brainstorm Design, NewDealDesign founder Gadi Amit said he was "proud" of his early skepticism of design thinking.
